questions.question: What does AI stand for?
Which programming language is commonly used in AI development?
What is the purpose of a neural network in AI?
Which technique allows AI systems to learn from experience?
What is the goal of natural language processing (NLP) in AI?
Which AI technique is inspired by the functioning of the human brain?
What is the main limitation of rule-based expert systems?
Which AI application is used to analyze large datasets and make predictions?
What is the role of machine learning in AI?
questions.choose3: C. Enabling computers to learn without explicit programming

questions.question: Which AI technique is used for making decisions under uncertainty?
Which type of learning is associated with labeled training data?
Which AI technique is used to mimic human conversation?
Which AI application involves training machines to see and understand visual data?
What is the purpose of an AI chatbot?
Which AI technique is used for solving complex optimization problems?
Which AI application involves teaching machines to understand and generate human speech?
What is the main goal of computer vision in AI?
Which AI technique is used to handle incomplete or uncertain information?
What is the main application of AI in autonomous vehicles?
Which AI technique is used for predicting future outcomes based on historical data?
What does CNN stand for?
What is the primary purpose of using convolutional layers in a CNN?
Which of the following is NOT a common activation function used in CNNs?
What is the purpose of pooling layers in a CNN?
Which layer is responsible for learning and updating the weights in a CNN?
Which type of layer is typically used as the final layer in a CNN for classification tasks?
What is the purpose of zero-padding in a convolutional layer?
Which operation is performed by the pooling layer in a CNN?
Which type of layer is responsible for the spatial invariance property of CNNs?
Which technique is commonly used to prevent overfitting in CNNs?
What is the purpose of stride in a convolutional layer?
questions.choose1: A. To adjust the learning rate
questions.choose2: B. To control the filter size
questions.choose3: C. To determine the output size
questions.choose4: D. To control the filter movement

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of using a CNN over a fully connected neural network for image processing?
questions.choose3: C. Better generalization on new images

questions.question: Which layer is responsible for capturing global features in a CNN?
Which technique is commonly used to initialize the weights in a CNN?
What is the purpose of using multiple channels in a convolutional layer?
questions.choose1: A. To increase the receptive field
questions.choose2: B. To reduce the number of parameters
questions.choose3: C. To capture different types of features

questions.question: Which type of layer is responsible for introducing nonlinearity in a CNN?
Which technique is commonly used to visualize the learned features in a CNN?
Which layer is responsible for reducing the spatial dimensions in a CNN?
Which technique is commonly used to handle vanishing gradients in deep CNNs?
Which layer is responsible for producing the final output predictions in a CNN?
What is the Transformer architecture primarily used for?
Which component of the Transformer model is responsible for capturing the relationships between different words in a sequence?
What is the purpose of positional encoding in the Transformer model?
questions.choose1: A. To handle variable-length input sequences
questions.choose2: B. To introduce nonlinearity in the model
questions.choose4: D. To represent the order of words in a sequence

questions.question: Which type of attention is used in the Transformer model?
In the Transformer model, what is the purpose of the encoder?
questions.choose3: C. To encode input sequences into hidden representations

questions.question: Which activation function is commonly used in the Transformer model?
What is the purpose of the decoder in the Transformer model?
questions.choose2: B. To encode input sequences into hidden representations

questions.question: How are the attention scores computed in the Transformer model?
Which technique is commonly used to improve the efficiency of the Transformer model?
What is the purpose of the positional-wise feed-forward networks in the Transformer model?
What is the role of the residual connections in the Transformer model?
questions.choose1: A. To allow gradients to flow directly

questions.question: Which type of problem is the Transformer model well-suited for?
What is the purpose of multi-head attention in the Transformer model?
Which algorithm is commonly used to train the Transformer model?
Which layer normalization technique is used in the Transformer model?
What is the purpose of the mask in the self-attention mechanism of the Transformer model?
questions.choose1: A. To restrict attention to future positions
questions.choose2: B. To prioritize attention to specific positions

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used to handle long input sequences in the Transformer model?
Which metric is commonly used to evaluate the performance of the Transformer model in machine translation tasks?
What is the main advantage of the Transformer model over recurrent neural networks (RNNs) for sequence-to-sequence tasks?
questions.choose1: A. Better handling of long-term dependencies

questions.question: Which Transformer variant introduces the concept of pre-training and fine-tuning on large-scale language modeling tasks?
What is the goal of natural language processing (NLP)?
Which of the following is an example of a pre-processing step in NLP?
What is the purpose of tokenization in NLP?
questions.choose1: A. To split text into individual words or tokens
questions.choose2: B. To remove stop words from text
questions.choose3: C. To convert text to lowercase
questions.choose4: D. To replace abbreviations with their full forms

questions.question: What is the main challenge of named entity recognition (NER) in NLP?
questions.choose3: C. Identifying and classifying named entities in text

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used for sentiment analysis in NLP?
What is the purpose of word embedding in NLP?
questions.choose1: A. To represent words as numeric vectors

questions.question: Which model architecture is commonly used for machine translation in NLP?
questions.choose4: D. Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers (BERT)

questions.question: What is the purpose of named entity recognition (NER) in NLP?
questions.choose1: A. To determine the sentiment of a text
questions.choose2: B. To identify the grammatical structure of a sentence
questions.choose3: C. To extract and classify named entities from text

questions.choose1: A. To determine the sentiment of a text
questions.choose2: B. To identify the grammatical structure of a sentence

questions.choose1: A. To determine the sentiment of a text

questions.choose3: C. To extract and classify named entities from text

questions.choose2: B. To convert speech to text
questions.choose4: D. To classify documents into categories

questions.question: Which evaluation metric is commonly used for machine translation tasks in NLP?

questions.choose1: A. To determine the sentiment of a text
questions.choose2: B. To identify the grammatical structure of a sentence
